wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.wrappers.imagej.core

Class ImageThresholdingIJ

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrapScienceJ.resource.generic.ResourceCoreGeneric
      • wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.wrappers.imagej.core.ImageCoreIJ
        • wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.wrappers.imagej.core.ImageCoreGray8IJ
          • wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.wrappers.imagej.core.ImageThresholdingIJ
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceCore, ImageCore, ImageCoreGray8, ImageThresholding

    public class ImageThresholdingIJ
extends ImageCoreGray8IJ
implements ImageThresholding
    This class proposes some functionalities such as histogram construction and management for an image. It also implements some classical thresholding based binarization methods, or threshold computation for the same methods. The class also exposes the public methods of ImageCore, thus avoiding the need several class instances or references for dealing with the same image.
    Author:
    Remy Malgoures
    See Also:
    ThresholdingOption, Histogram, ImageCore

      • getHistogram

      • applyImageThresholdKeepGray

        public ImageCoreIJ applyImageThresholdKeepGray(int threshold,
                                               boolean convertToGray8)
        Description copied from interface: ImageThresholding
        Performs thresholding on this image using a given threshold value, i.e. Any voxel with a value greater than or equal to the threshold have their value set to 0, and all other voxels have their values unchanged. The input threshold is normalized, independently from the gray level representation (bit depth), between 0 and 255. This means that the input threshold will be multiplied by 256 in case of 16 bits per voxel.
        Specified by:
        applyImageThresholdKeepGray in interface ImageThresholding
        Parameters:
        threshold - the normalized value for the threshold between 0 and 255.
        convertToGray8 - If true, the binarized image is to be converted to GRAY8. This option is ignored if this image already has type GRAY8.
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageThresholding.applyImageThresholdAndBinarize(int, boolean)

      • applyImageThresholdAndBinarize

        public ImageCoreIJ applyImageThresholdAndBinarize(int threshold,
                                                  boolean convertToGray8)
        Description copied from interface: ImageThresholding
        Performs thresholding on this image using a given threshold value, i.e. Any voxel with a value greater than or equal to the threshold have their value set to 0, and all other voxels have their values set to the maximal possible gray level. The input threshold is normalized, independently from the gray level representation (bit depth), between 0 and 255. This means that the input threshold will be multiplied by 256 in case of 16 bits per voxel.
        Specified by:
        applyImageThresholdAndBinarize in interface ImageThresholding
        Parameters:
        threshold - the value for the threshold between 0 and 255.
        convertToGray8 - If true, the binarized image is to be converted to GRAY8. This option is ignored if this image already has type GRAY8.
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageThresholding.applyImageThresholdAndBinarize(int, boolean)

      • applyThresholdMinAndMax

        public ImageCoreIJ applyThresholdMinAndMax(double min,
                                           double max)
        Description copied from interface: ImageThresholding
        Sets to zero the voxels with values which are not between the minimum and maximum value given as parameters. The other voxels have their colors unchanged.
        Specified by:
        applyThresholdMinAndMax in interface ImageThresholding
        Parameters:
        min - new minimum value of the display range, between 0.0 and 1.0, in fraction of the total values range for the bit depth.
        max - new maximum value of the display range, between 0.0 and 1.0, in fraction of the total values range for the bit depth.
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageThresholding.applyThresholdMinAndMax(double, double)

      • getBinarizationThreshold

        public int getBinarizationThreshold(ThresholdingOption method)
        Computes the grey level threshold value for binarizing an image using this instance's histogram. Different method can be used to compute the threshold.
        Specified by:
        getBinarizationThreshold in interface ImageThresholding
        Parameters:
        method - the thresholding method
        Returns:
        the threshold for the image

      • thresholdImageKeepGray

        public ImageCoreIJ thresholdImageKeepGray(ThresholdingOption method,
                                          boolean convertToGray8)
        Description copied from interface: ImageThresholding
        Performs thresholding on this image using a given method option, i.e. Any voxel with a value greater than or equal to the threshold have their value set to 0. All other voxels have their values kept unchanged.
        Specified by:
        thresholdImageKeepGray in interface ImageThresholding
        Parameters:
        method - the method to use for thresholding.
        convertToGray8 - If true, the binarized image is to be converted to GRAY8. This option is ignored if this image already has type GRAY8.
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageThresholding.thresholdImageKeepGray(wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.core.operation.ThresholdingOption, boolean)

      • thresholdImageAndBinarize

        public ImageCoreIJ thresholdImageAndBinarize(ThresholdingOption method,
                                             boolean convertToGray8)
        Description copied from interface: ImageThresholding
        Performs thresholding on this image using a given method option, i.e. Any voxel with a value greater than or equal to the threshold have their value set to 0. all other voxels are set to white.
        Specified by:
        thresholdImageAndBinarize in interface ImageThresholding
        Parameters:
        method - the method to use for thresholding.
        convertToGray8 - If true, the binarized image is to be converted to GRAY8. This option is ignored if this image already has type GRAY8.
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageThresholding.thresholdImageAndBinarize(wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.core.operation.ThresholdingOption, boolean)

      • adaptiveThresholdPreprocess

        public ImageCore adaptiveThresholdPreprocess(double sigmaX,
                                             double sigmaY,
                                             double sigmaZ,
                                             double powExponent,
                                             double exponentValues,
                                             double impact)
        Description copied from interface: ImageThresholding
        Performs an adptive thresholding on this image using a given method option, i.e. Any voxel with a value greater than or equal to the threshold have their value set to 0. However, the threshold is weighed to take into account the intensities in a vicinity of the considered voxel, to account for a relative contrast of the voxel in a neighborhood. TODO Has to be tested and tuned.
        Specified by:
        adaptiveThresholdPreprocess in interface ImageThresholding
        Parameters:
        sigmaX - The typical width of the neighborhood taken into account
        sigmaY - The typical height of the neighborhood taken into account
        sigmaZ - The typical depth of the neighborhood taken into account
        powExponent - Exponent on the histogram value in the histogram equalization's integration
        exponentValues - Increases the dynamics of veriy bright spots being attenuated.
        impact - A coefficient between zero and one. The lower, the less adaptive. Setting impact to zero is just a costly way to compute ImageThresholding.thresholdImageAndBinarize(ThresholdingOption, boolean).
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageThresholding.adaptiveThresholdPreprocess(double, double, double, double, double, double)
